summary: The document is a part of the John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Collection, specifically detailing the personal, educational, military, and employment history of David Reed Fromer. It highlights his conscientious objector status, legal proceedings related to it, and his refusal to execute DD Form 398 in its entirety based on legal advice. The document provides comprehensive personal information without any mention of foreign property or business connections.
key_findings: David Reed Fromer was born on July 21, 1942, in Chicago, Illinois.
He pursued education at several institutions, including the University of California, Berkeley, and City College of San Francisco.
Fromer declared himself a conscientious objector, with his case under legal review at the time of the document's creation.
Advised by his lawyers, Fromer refused to fully execute DD Form 398, citing potential legal jeopardy.
The document meticulously records Fromer's personal details, employment history, and affiliations, noting no foreign property or business ties.
